docs.snippet: In some 200 films and several popular sitcoms, she played doting sisters, mothers and grandmothers.

headline.main: Shammi, Bollywood Actress Known for Comedic Roles, Dies at 89

docs.snippet: Rebels in the territory suffered their worst day of casualties in years, with a dozen killed. At least three soldiers and four civilians also died.

docs.snippet: In her 36 years, Madhubala starred in more than 70 movies, often portraying modern young women testing the limits of traditions.

headline.main: Madhubala, a Bollywood Legend Whose Tragic Life Mirrored Marilyn Monroe’s

docs.snippet: Naina Shah and Abhishek Honawar work between New York and India: she in fashion, he in hospitality. Next, they will team up on their own design studio.

headline.main: The Creative Couple Bridging the Worlds of Hospitality and Embroidery

docs.snippet: I sat and listened. That’s what journalists do: listen through silences, awaiting a clue.

docs.snippet: The prime minister of the self-declared Tibetan government-in-exile in India has urged his compatriots to strengthen efforts to make the return of the Dalai Lama to his native land a reality.

docs.snippet: The world's richest cricket board was set to pocket nearly double of what it gained from the previous cycle of media rights after bidding for the next five years of Indian cricket could not be wrapped on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Cricket-Indian Board Set for Windfall From Media Rights
headline.main: Cricket-Indian Board Set for Windfall From Media Rights
